This is here and now I'm broadcasting from Southern California today as part of our election road trip it's a part of the country that is on the frontlines of the debate over immigration many California cities have taking matters into their own hands either by declaring themselves sanctuaries from immigration enforcement
You quote unquote broke the law by coming to this country to work with there was a work of plenty that's not something that I see that a city should be looking to arrest somebody four
Or five voicing their support for immigration and Customs Enforcement or ice this is really about rule of law and about to local control this year a new state law took effect in California limiting how much local police can cooperate with federal immigration authorities
The law sb fifty four is called the California values act he's also known as the sanctuary law and has drawn lawsuits from the Trump Administration in several cities in California
But the legal battle kicked off in the small town of Los Alamos which voted to opt out of the law in March and it's now being sued by the American civil liberties union was telling me to city manager for Edgar says the sanctuary state law goes too far
You look at this it's really the difference between the boundaries of separation of powers between local jurisdictions state jurisdiction in federal

Likely to work with law enforcement on major crimes reporting things that are out because they're afraid of deportation

Actors that are illegal that get put in jail and then are not released back to the federal government come back into their communities and continue to terrorize their community and so from their perspective they are very thankful I think a lot of this says it's the politics and the soundbite source of the reality of what's going on on the ground
Edgar met with President Trump earlier this year he's been in regular contact with the White House since the move by his city has been called racist and Xena phobic I asked him about that
I don't think that has anything to do with racism um I I probably the best example and the real life example I gave us my wife is from Iran
She came when the shah was overthrown sheets of Christian in Iran she basically had to get asylum in Paris for two years and wait in turn to get into the United states and so you know that is
The way immigration should work and you know I don't have anything ah about love for immigrants and I've actually you know with with my wife as an example I mean this has nothing to do with um it'd be an anti immigrant or racist
